response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "low", "Young age may reduce recidivism risk."),
    ("arrests", "medium", "Single prior arrest, but with a conviction suggests some level of risk."),
    ("convictions", "medium", "One prior conviction indicates higher risk compared to no convictions."),
    ("employment", "high", "No employment during the year is concerning as it may indicate lack of structure and purpose."),
    ("education", "low", "Enrolled in college could be a positive factor, but current unemployment might offset this slightly."),
    ("marital_status", "low", "Single status does not inherently increase or decrease risk significantly."),
    ("drug_use", "medium", "Past four years of drug use and recent depressive symptoms may indicate underlying issues."),
    ("living_arrangements", "low", "Living alone is neutral; it could be a positive if he uses this time for personal growth, but without employment, it might not be beneficial."),
    ("family_background", "low", "Growing up with both parents in an urban area generally has no strong correlation with recidivism."),
    ("religious_affiliation", "high", "Lack of belief in God or any higher power may correlate with increased risk as it could indicate a lack of moral guidance.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Asian / Pacific Islander. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
